titleInfo.title: It may be far to Tipperary it's a longer way to Tennessee, 1914

mods.identifier: KAKC-It May Be Far to Tipperary-TN

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219.

mods.abstract: Based on the English Music Hall song, "It's A Long Way To Tipperary" (1912, by Harry Williams and Jack Judge) which became a favorite and famous marching song of the British Expeditionary Force at the very outbreak of World War I in August, 1914, this Tin Pan Alley takeoff by lyricist Arthur J. Lamb and composer Alfred Solman was written in those first months of war (1914) and features a soldier with a sweetheart not from Tipperary (Ireland) but rather from Tennessee, already famous as the Volunteer State. Forms part of the Kenneth A. Kanter American Music and Theatre Collection. 1 sheet music publication (5 p.)

titleInfo.title: Kenneth A. Kanter American Music and Theatre Collection
